meanings.definition: To ring a bell slowly and repeatedly
meanings.sent1: The church bell tolled mournfully for the passing of a loved one.
meanings.sent2: Every evening, the grandfather clock tolled the hour with a deep sound.
meanings.sent3: The bell tolled so loudly that it startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the distant bells tolled like a melancholic symphony.
meanings.sent5: The tolling of the bell echoed through the empty streets, creating a somber atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To charge a fee or tax
meanings.sent1: The museum tolled a small entrance fee for visitors.
meanings.sent2: The government tolled a tax on imported goods to generate revenue.
meanings.sent3: The tolling of extra fees made the total cost of the trip much higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: The company tolled a penalty for late payments, adding to the financial burden.
meanings.sent5: The tolling of taxes on businesses affected their profitability significantly.

meanings.definition: To announce or summon by tolling a bell
meanings.sent1: The town crier tolled the bell to gather everyone for an important announcement.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, church bells tolled to call people to worship.
meanings.sent3: The tolling of the bell signaled the start of the festival, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent4: As the sun rose, the bell tolled, heralding the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The tolling of the bell could be heard far and wide, uniting the community in celebration.
